- [Introduction](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/install-the-server/introduction.md): Read this before starting the SonarQube server installation.
- [Installing the database](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/install-the-server/installing-the-database.md): Install the SonarQube database according to the database engine used: MicrosoftSQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL
- [Installing SonarQube from the ZIP file](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/install-the-server/installing-sonarqube-from-zip-file.md): Explains how to install the SonarQube server from the ZIP file.
- [Installing SonarQube from the Docker image](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/install-the-server/installing-sonarqube-from-docker.md): Explains how to install the SonarQube server from the Docker image.
- [Advanced installation features](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/install-the-server/advanced-installation-features.md): Explains how to perform advanced setup on SonarQube server including web connection parameter change.
- [Troubleshooting](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/install-the-server/troubleshooting.md): Explains how to troubleshoot issues with SonarQube server installation.
- [Configure and operate a server](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/configure-and-operate-a-server.md)
- [Operating the server](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/configure-and-operate-a-server/operating-the-server.md): Learn how to configure and operate the SonarQube server.
- [Environment variables](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/configure-and-operate-a-server/environment-variables.md): This page provides environment variables used for configuring SonarQube with Docker.
- [Install a plugin](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/install-a-plugin.md): Learn how to install a plugin in SonarQube.
- [Install the server as a cluster](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/install-the-server-as-a-cluster.md): The Data Center Edition allows SonarQube to run in a clustered configuration to make it resilient to failures.
- [Configure and operate a cluster](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/configure-and-operate-a-cluster.md): Once the SonarQube cluster is installed, your configuration allows your SonarQube instance to stay up even in case of a crash or failure in one of the nodes.
- [Deploy on Kubernetes](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/deploy-on-kubernetes.md)
- [Deploying SonarQube](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/deploy-on-kubernetes/sonarqube.md): Learn how to deploy SonarQube on Kubernetes.
- [Deploying a SonarQube cluster](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/deploy-on-kubernetes/cluster.md): Learn how to deploy a SonarQube cluster on Kubernetes.
- [Setting up the monitoring](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/deploy-on-kubernetes/set-up-monitoring.md)
- [Introduction](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/deploy-on-kubernetes/set-up-monitoring/introduction.md): If you deploy SonarQube on Kubernetes, Prometheus metrics can be collected.
- [Setting up with the Prometheus server](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/deploy-on-kubernetes/set-up-monitoring/prometheus.md): The SonarQube’s Helm chart triggers the deployment of a Prometheus server that will pull the metrics from the SonarQube instance.
- [Setting up with Datadog](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/deploy-on-kubernetes/set-up-monitoring/datadog.md): In case of a Kubernetes deployment, you can use Datadog to collect the metrics provided through the SonarQube’s Web API (Openmetrics format).
- [List of Prometheus metrics](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/deploy-on-kubernetes/set-up-monitoring/prometheus-metrics.md): List of the SonarQube metrics exposed by Prometheus.
- [Upgrade the server](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/upgrade-the-server.md)
- [Upgrade roadmap](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/upgrade-the-server/roadmap.md): The section lists the steps you have to perform to upgrade your SonarQube server installation.
- [Determining the upgrade path](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/upgrade-the-server/determine-path.md): This section explains the principles to follow in order to determine if you can perform the upgrade directly or must upgrade first to intermediary version(s).
- [Testing the upgrade](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/upgrade-the-server/testing.md): Test your upgrade before performing the upgrade.
- [Performing the upgrade](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/upgrade-the-server/upgrade.md): Once you have determined your upgrade path and tested your upgrade, you can perform your SonarQube server upgrade.
- [Performing the post-upgrade steps](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/upgrade-the-server/post-upgrade-steps.md): You must perform various tasks after a SonarQube server upgrade.
- [Other migration-related procedures](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/upgrade-the-server/other-procedures.md): This section explains how to revert to the previous version of SonarQube, how to move to another edition, how to migrate the database to another vendor.
- [Release upgrade notes](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/release-upgrade-notes.md): List of release upgrade notes for SonarQube.
- [Troubleshooting](/sonarqube-server/10.4/setup-and-upgrade/troubleshooting.md): Try these troubleshooting methods if you’re encountering unexpected behaviors with your SonarQube instance.
- [Analyzing source code](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code.md)
- [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/overview.md): SonarQube can perform analysis on 20+ different languages.
- [Scanner environment](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scanner-environment.md)
- [General requirements](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scanner-environment/general-requirements.md): This page describes requirements or recommendations regarding the machine running the scanner and the actions you may need to take in order to meet them.
- [Installing the server’s self-signed certificate](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scanner-environment/install-self-signed-certificate.md): If your SonarQube Server is configured with HTTPS and a self-signed certificate then you must import the self-signed certificate to the scanner environment.
- [Scanners](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scanners.md)
- [SonarScanner for Gradle](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarscanner-for-gradle.md): The SonarScanner for Gradle provides an easy way to start the analysis of a Gradle project with SonarQube.
- [SonarScanner for .NET](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarscanner-for-dotnet.md): The SonarScanner for .NET is the recommended way to launch an analysis for projects built using MSBuild or dotnet.
- [SonarScanner for Maven](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarscanner-for-maven.md): The SonarScanner for Maven is recommended as the default scanner for Maven projects.
- [SonarQube extension for Azure DevOps](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarqube-extension-for-azure-devops.md): The SonarQube extension for Azure DevOps makes it easy to integrate analysis into your build pipeline, allowing the analysis of all supported languages.
- [Jenkins extension for SonarQube](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scanners/jenkins-extension-sonarqube.md): This plugin lets you centralize the configuration of SonarQube server connection details in Jenkins global configuration.
- [SonarScanner for Ant](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarscanner-for-ant.md): The SonarScanner for Ant provides a task to allow the integration of SonarQube analysis into an Apache Ant build script.
- [SonarScanner CLI](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarscanner.md): The SonarScanner CLI is the scanner to use when there is no specific scanner for your build system.
- [Analysis parameters](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/analysis-parameters.md): The most comprehensive listing of the parameters available in SonarQube.
- [Languages](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages.md)
- [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/overview.md): SonarQube provides analysis of different languages depending on the edition you’re running.
- [ABAP](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/abap.md): ABAP analysis is available starting in Developer Edition of SonarQube.
- [Apex](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/apex.md): Apex analysis is available starting in Enterprise Edition of SonarQube.
- [Azure Resource Manager](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/azure-resource-manager.md): SonarQube analysis supports Azure Resource Manager templates in the JSON & Bicep formats, and is available starting in Community Edition.
- [C/C++/Objective-C](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/c-family.md): C/C++/Objective-C analysis is available starting in Developer Edition.
- [CloudFormation](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/cloudformation.md): SonarQube can analyze Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) languages such as CloudFormation, Kubernetes, and Terraform.
- [COBOL](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/cobol.md): Cobol analysis is available starting in Enterprise Edition.
- [C#](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/csharp.md): C# analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
- [Docker](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/docker.md): SonarQube can analyze Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) languages such as CloudFormation, Kubernetes, and Terraform.
- [Flex](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/flex.md): Flex analysis is available starting in all editions of SonarQube.
- [Go](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/go.md): Go analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
- [HTML](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/html.md): HTML analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
- [Java](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/java.md): Java analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
- [JavaScript/TypeScript/CSS](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/javascript-typescript-css.md): JavaScript/TypeScript/CSS analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
- [Kotlin](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/kotlin.md): Kotlin analysis is available starting in all editions of SonarQube.
- [Kubernetes](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/kubernetes.md): SonarQube can analyze Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) languages such as CloudFormation, Kubernetes, and Terraform.
- [PHP](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/php.md): PHP analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
- [PLI](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/pli.md): PLI analysis is available starting in Enterprise Edition.
- [PL/SQL](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/pl-sql.md): PL/SQL analysis is available starting in Developer Edition.
- [Python](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/python.md): Python analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
- [RPG](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/rpg.md): RPG is available starting in Enterprise Edition.
- [Ruby](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/ruby.md): Ruby analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
- [Scala](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/scala.md): Scala analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
- [Swift](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/swift.md): Swift analysis is available starting in Developer Edition.
- [Secrets](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/secrets.md): SonarQube detects exposed Secrets in your source code and language-agnostic config files, starting in Community Edition.
- [Terraform](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/terraform.md): SonarQube can analyze Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) languages such as CloudFormation, Kubernetes, and Terraform.
- [T-SQL](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/t-sql.md): T-SQL analysis is available starting in Developer Edition.
- [VB.NET](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/vb-dotnet.md): VB.NET analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
- [VB6](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/vb6.md): VB6 analysis is available starting in Enterprise Edition.
- [XML](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/languages/xml.md): XML analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
- [Test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage.md)
- [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/overview.md): Test coverage reports and test execution reports are important metrics in assessing the quality of your code.
- [Java test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/java-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage as part of the analysis of your Java project.
- [JavaScript/TypeScript test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/javascript-typescript-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage information as part of the analysis of your JS/TS project.
- [.NET test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/dotnet-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage information as part of the analysis of your .NET project.
- [Python test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/python-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage information as part of the analysis of your Python project.
- [PHP test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/php-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage information as part of the analysis of your PHP project.
- [C/C++/Objective-C test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/c-family-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage information as part of the analysis of your C/C++/Objective-C project.
- [Generic test data](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/generic-test-data.md): SonarQube supports generic formats for test coverage and test execution import.
- [Test coverage parameters](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/test-coverage-parameters.md): Test coverage reports describe the percentage of your code that has been tested by your test suite during a build.
- [Test execution parameters](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/test-execution-parameters.md): Test execution reports describe which tests within your test suite have been run during a build.
- [Importing external issues](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/importing-external-issues.md)
- [External analyzer reports](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/importing-external-issues/external-analyzer-reports.md): This page lists analysis parameters related to the import of issues raised by external, third-party analyzers.
- [Generic formatted reports](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/importing-external-issues/generic-issue-import-format.md): SonarQube supports a generic import format for raising external issues in code.
- [SARIF reports](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/importing-external-issues/importing-issues-from-sarif-reports.md): SonarQube supports the standard Static Analysis Results Interchange Format (SARIF) for raising external issues in code.
- [Background tasks](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/background-tasks.md): A background task can be: the import of an analysis report, the computation of a portfolio, or the import or export of a project.
- [Pull request analysis](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/pull-request-analysis.md): Pull request analysis shows your pull request’s quality gate and analysis in the SonarQube interface.
- [Branches](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/branches.md)
- [Branch analysis](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/branches/branch-analysis.md): With branch analysis in SonarQube, you can ensure that you’re maintaining consistent code quality all the way down to the branch level of your projects.
- [Branch FAQ](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/branches/branch-faq.md): Frequently asked questions about branch analysis in SonarQube.
- [CI integration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/ci-integration.md)
- [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/ci-integration/overview.md): SonarQube supports integration on multiple platforms allowing you to maintain code quality and security in your projects.
- [Jenkins integration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/ci-integration/jenkins-integration.md): SonarScanners running in Jenkins can automatically detect branches and pull requests in certain jobs.
- [Codemagic integration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/ci-integration/codemagic-integration.md): SonarScanners running in Codemagic can automatically detect branches and merge or pull requests in certain jobs.
- [SCM integration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/scm-integration.md): Collecting SCM data during code analysis can unlock a number of SonarQube features.
- [Security engine custom configuration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/security-engine-custom-configuration.md): Security Engine Custom Configuration is available as part of the Enterprise Edition. The security engine tracks the path that data follows through your code.
- [Troubleshooting the analysis](/sonarqube-server/10.4/analyzing-source-code/troubleshooting-the-analysis.md): If your SonarQube analysis errors out.
- [DevOps platform integration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/devops-platform-integration.md)
- [GitHub integration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/devops-platform-integration/github-integration.md): SonarQube’s integration with GitHub Enterprise and GitHub.com allows you to maintain code quality and security in your GitHub repositories.
- [Bitbucket integration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/devops-platform-integration/bitbucket-integration.md)
- [Bitbucket Server integration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/devops-platform-integration/bitbucket-integration/bitbucket-server-integration.md): SonarQube’s integration with Bitbucket Server allows you to maintain code quality and security in your Bitbucket Server repositories.
- [Bitbucket Cloud integration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/devops-platform-integration/bitbucket-integration/bitbucket-cloud-integration.md): SonarQube’s integration with Bitbucket Cloud allows you to maintain code quality and security in your Bitbucket Cloud repositories.
- [GitLab integration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/devops-platform-integration/gitlab-integration.md): SonarQube’s integration with GitLab Self-Managed and GitLab.com allows you to maintain code quality and security in your GitLab projects.
- [Azure DevOps integration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/devops-platform-integration/azure-devops-integration.md): SonarQube’s integration with Azure DevOps allows you to maintain code quality and security in your Azure DevOps repositories.
- [User guide](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide.md)
- [Concepts](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/concepts.md)
- [Clean Code](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/clean-code.md)
- [Introduction](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/clean-code/introduction.md): The Sonar solution is designed to help you achieve a state of Clean Code.
- [Clean Code definition](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/clean-code/definition.md): What is Clean Code? We define Clean Code as code that has the following attributes: consistency, intentionality, adaptability, and responsibility.
- [Clean Code benefits: the software qualities](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/clean-code/software-qualities.md): Why use Clean Code? Clean Code leads to software that is secure, reliable, and maintainable.
- [Code analysis based on Clean Code](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/clean-code/code-analysis.md): The Sonar solution is aimed at identifying any issue in your code that prevents it from being Clean Code.
- [Clean as You Code](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/clean-as-you-code.md): Sonar’s Clean as You Code approach enables developers and organizations to take ownership of code quality by solely focusing on code that’s added or changed.
- [SonarLint Connected Mode](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/sonarlint-connected-mode.md): SonarLint Connected Mode connects SonarLint to your SonarQube project and provides additional benefits you won’t get by using SonarLint or SonarQube alone.
- [Metric definitions](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/metric-definitions.md): SonarQube analysis produces many types of code analysis metrics.
- [Quality gates](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/quality-gates.md): Quality Gates enforce a quality policy in your organization by answering one question: is my project ready for release?
- [Rules](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/rules.md)
- [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/rules/overview.md): SonarQube evaluates your source code against its set of rules to generate issues.
- [Security-related rules](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/rules/security-related-rules.md): The SonarQube Quality Model has four different types of rules: Reliability (bug), Maintainability (code smell), Security (vulnerability and hotspot) rules.
- [Built-in rule tags](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/rules/built-in-rule-tags.md): SonarQube users can add tags to rules and issues and most rules have some built-in tags out of the box.
- [User account](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/user-account.md)
- [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/user-account/overview.md): As a SonarQube user, you have your own space where you can see the things that are relevant to you.
- [Generating and using tokens](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/user-account/generating-and-using-tokens.md): Users can generate tokens that can be used to run analyses or invoke web services without access to the user’s actual credentials.
- [Issues](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/issues.md): While running an analysis, SonarQube raises an issue every time a piece of code breaks a coding rule.
- [Security Hotspots](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/security-hotspots.md): A security hotspot highlights a security-sensitive piece of code that the developer needs to review.
- [Portfolios](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/portfolios.md): The portfolios home page is the central place for managers and tech leads to keep an eye on the releasability of the projects under their supervision.
- [Applications](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/applications.md): An application aggregates multiple projects into a synthetic single project.
- [Security Reports](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/security-reports.md): Security reports give you the big picture of your application’s security. They allow you to know where you stand compared to the most common security mistakes.
- [Activity and history](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/activity-and-history.md): The Activity page offers you the ability to see the evolution of project measures over time.
- [Project page](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/project-page.md): The Project homepage is the entry point of any project showing the releasability status of the project, its current code quality, and the code quality to date.
- [Keyboard shortcuts](/sonarqube-server/10.4/user-guide/keyboard-shortcuts.md): A list of keyboard shortcuts for use with SonarCloud.
- [Project administration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/project-administration.md)
- [Creating and importing projects](/sonarqube-server/10.4/project-administration/creating-and-importing-projects.md): How to create and import projects in SonarQube.
- [Managing project history](/sonarqube-server/10.4/project-administration/managing-project-history.md): One of the most powerful features of SonarQube is that it shows you not just your project health today, but how it has changed over time.
- [Analysis scope](/sonarqube-server/10.4/project-administration/analysis-scope.md): There are many cases where you do not want to analyze every source file in your project. In such cases, you can adjust the analysis scope.
- [Clean as You Code settings](/sonarqube-server/10.4/project-administration/clean-as-you-code-settings.md)
- [Defining new code](/sonarqube-server/10.4/project-administration/clean-as-you-code-settings/defining-new-code.md): Defining what is considered new code is an important part of SonarQube’s Clean as You Code approach to code quality and safety.
- [Managing portfolios](/sonarqube-server/10.4/project-administration/managing-portfolios.md): This page has information on managing and setting up portfolios.
- [Managing applications](/sonarqube-server/10.4/project-administration/managing-applications.md): This page explains how to manage SonarQube applications.
- [PDF reports](/sonarqube-server/10.4/project-administration/pdf-reports.md): PDF reports give a periodic, high-level overview of the overall code quality and security of your projects, applications, or portfolios.
- [Project settings](/sonarqube-server/10.4/project-administration/project-settings.md): Project administration is accessible through the Project Settings menu of each project.
- [Webhooks](/sonarqube-server/10.4/project-administration/webhooks.md): Webhooks notify external services when a project analysis is complete.
- [Instance administration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration.md)
- [Quality profiles](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/quality-profiles.md): Quality profiles are a key part of your SonarQube configuration. They define the set of rules to be applied during code analysis.
- [Security](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/security.md): SonarQube comes with a number of global security features.
- [Authentication and provisioning](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication.md)
- [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/overview.md): SonarQube can delegate authentication via HTTP Headers, GitHub Authentication, GitLab Authentication, Bitbucket Cloud Authentication, SAML, or LDAP.
- [HTTP header](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/http-header.md): You can delegate user authentication to third-party systems (proxies/servers) using HTTP header authentication.
- [LDAP](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/ldap.md): You can configure SonarQube authentication and authorization to an LDAP server (including the LDAP service of Active Directory)
- [SAML](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/saml.md)
- [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/saml/overview.md): You can delegate authentication to a SAML 2.0 identity provider using SAML authentication. SonarQube uses the Service Provider (SP) initiated SAML.
- [How to setup Azure AD](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/saml/how-to-set-up-azure-ad.md): The following content may be useful if you’re using Azure AD as a SAML Identity Provider.
- [How to set up Keycloak](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/saml/how-to-set-up-keycloak.md): The following content may be useful if you’re using Keycloak as a SAML identity provider.
- [How to set up Okta](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/saml/how-to-set-up-okta.md): The following example may be useful if you are using Okta as a SAML identity provider.
- [SCIM](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/saml/scim.md)
- [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/saml/scim/overview.md): SCIM helps you automatically provision user and groups to SonarQube.
- [SCIM provisioning with Azure AD](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/saml/scim/scim-provisioning-with-azure-ad.md): Enable SCIM to automate user and group provisioning from Azure AD to SonarQube
- [SCIM provisioning with Okta](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/saml/scim/scim-provisioning-with-okta.md): Enable SCIM to automate user and group provisioning from Okta to SonarQube
- [GitHub](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/github.md): To allow users to log in with GitHub credentials, you must use a GitHub App.
- [Bitbucket Cloud](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/bitbucket-cloud.md): To allow users to log in with Bitbucket Cloud credentials, you need to use an OAuth consumer and set the authentication settings in SonarQube.
- [GitLab](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/authentication/gitlab.md): You can delegate authentication to GitLab using a dedicated GitLab OAuth application.
- [Look and feel](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/look-and-feel.md): You can set your own home logo and use a Gravatar avatar.
- [Marketplace](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/marketplace.md): The Marketplace is the place for keeping the pieces of the SonarQube platform up to date.
- [Plugin version matrix](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/plugin-version-matrix.md): This table describes the version of each plugin that is compatible with each version of SonarQube.
- [Housekeeping](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/housekeeping.md): Default settings for SonarQube’s database cleaner.
- [Monitoring](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/monitoring.md)
- [Instance monitoring](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/monitoring/instance.md): Monitor your SonarQube instance to keep it healthy and happy.
- [Lines of Code](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/monitoring/lines-of-code.md): Information about how SonarQube calculates the Lines of Code analyzed to measure against the subscription’s limit defined by the license.
- [Audit logs](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/monitoring/audit-logs.md): How to manage the trail of your SonarQube audit logs.
- [API deprecation](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/monitoring/api-deprecation.md): If you use custom plugins based on the plugin API or consume SonarQube services, you should monitor the deprecation of the APIs.
- [Server logs and system info](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/server-logs-and-system-info.md): How to gather detailed information about your SonarQube instance.
- [Notifications](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/notifications.md): Everything to know about configuring SonarQube’s email notifications.
- [License administration](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/license-administration.md): How to retrieve, setup, stage and request new SonarQube licenses.
- [Project move](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/project-move.md): Project Move allows you to export a project from one SonarQube instance and import it into another SonarQube instance.
- [Improving performance](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/improving-performance.md): How to improve the performance of your SonarQube instance.
- [SonarQube DB Copy Tool](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/sonarqube-db-copy-tool.md): The SonarQube database copy tool helps you migrate your SonarQube database between vendors.
- [Backup and restore](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/backup-and-restore.md): We recommend using your database’s tools to back up your data.
- [Reindexing](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/reindexing.md): Starting SonarQube after an upgrade or after a restore from a backup triggers a rebuild of the Elasticsearch indexes.
- [Telemetry](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/telemetry.md): SonarQube sends anonymized telemetry data to Sonar daily. No personally identifiable information is sent.
- [Custom messages](/sonarqube-server/10.4/instance-administration/custom-messages.md): Administrators using the Enterprise edition of SonarQube can now display a custom login message that all users will see on their login screen.
- [Extension Guide](/sonarqube-server/10.4/extension-guide.md)
- [Web API](/sonarqube-server/10.4/extension-guide/web-api.md): SonarQube provides the Web API to access its functionalities from applications.
- [Adding coding rules](/sonarqube-server/10.4/extension-guide/adding-coding-rules.md): How to add custom coding rules to your SonarQube analysis.
- [Developing a plugin](/sonarqube-server/10.4/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin.md)
- [Plugin basics](/sonarqube-server/10.4/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin/plugin-basics.md): The sonar-plugin-api is a Java API used to develop plugins for SonarQube, SonarCloud and SonarLint.
- [Supporting new languages](/sonarqube-server/10.4/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin/supporting-new-languages.md): Six steps to support new languages in SonarQube.
- [Executable lines](/sonarqube-server/10.4/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin/executable-lines.md): Sonar internal guidelines to define executable lines for a language.
- [Adding pages to the webapp](/sonarqube-server/10.4/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin/adding-pages-to-the-webapp.md): Creating page extensions to run in your SonarQube environment.
- [Supporting SCM providers](/sonarqube-server/10.4/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin/supporting-scm-providers.md): Information from the Source Code Management (SCM) provider is used by the SonarQube scanner.
- [Internationalization](/sonarqube-server/10.4/extension-guide/internationalization.md): Guidelines to apply the i18n mechanism and how to help the Community
- [Contributing](/sonarqube-server/10.4/extension-guide/contributing.md): Guidelines about giving feedback and using the SonarQube community forum.

* [Homepage](/sonarqube-server/10.3/readme.md): SonarQube is a self-managed, automatic code review tool that systematically helps you deliver clean code.
* [Try out SonarQube](/sonarqube-server/10.3/try-out-sonarqube.md): Follow these steps to try out SonarQube.

* [Install a plugin](/sonarqube-server/10.3/setup-and-upgrade/install-a-plugin.md): Learn how to install a plugin in SonarQube.
* [Install the server as a cluster](/sonarqube-server/10.3/setup-and-upgrade/install-the-server-as-a-cluster.md): The Data Center Edition allows SonarQube to run in a clustered configuration to make it resilient to failures.
* [Configure and operate a cluster](/sonarqube-server/10.3/setup-and-upgrade/configure-and-operate-a-cluster.md): Once the SonarQube cluster is installed, your configuration allows your SonarQube instance to stay up even in case of a crash or failure in one of the nodes.
* [Deploy on Kubernetes](/sonarqube-server/10.3/setup-and-upgrade/deploy-on-kubernetes.md)

* [Upgrade the server](/sonarqube-server/10.3/setup-and-upgrade/upgrade-the-server.md)
* [Before you upgrade](/sonarqube-server/10.3/setup-and-upgrade/upgrade-the-server/before-you-upgrade.md): This page contains some concepts and recommendations that you should familiarize yourself with before upgrading to another SonarQube version.
* [Upgrade guide](/sonarqube-server/10.3/setup-and-upgrade/upgrade-the-server/upgrade-guide.md): This is a generic guide for upgrading across versions of SonarQube.
* [Release upgrade notes](/sonarqube-server/10.3/setup-and-upgrade/release-upgrade-notes.md): List of release upgrade notes for SonarQube.

* [Analyzing source code](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code.md)
* [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/overview.md): SonarQube can perform analysis on 20+ different languages.
* [Scanners](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/scanners.md)
* [SonarScanner for Gradle](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarscanner-for-gradle.md): The SonarScanner for Gradle provides an easy way to start the analysis of a Gradle project with SonarQube.
* [SonarScanner for .NET](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarscanner-for-dotnet.md): The SonarScanner for .NET is the recommended way to launch an analysis for projects built using MSBuild or dotnet.
* [SonarScanner for Maven](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarscanner-for-maven.md): The SonarScanner for Maven is recommended as the default scanner for Maven projects.
* [SonarQube extension for Azure DevOps](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarqube-extension-for-azure-devops.md): The SonarQube extension for Azure DevOps makes it easy to integrate analysis into your build pipeline, allowing the analysis of all supported languages.
* [Jenkins extension for SonarQube](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/scanners/jenkins-extension-sonarqube.md): This plugin lets you centralize the configuration of SonarQube server connection details in Jenkins global configuration.
* [SonarScanner for Ant](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarscanner-for-ant.md): The SonarScanner for Ant provides a task to allow the integration of SonarQube analysis into an Apache Ant build script.
* [SonarScanner CLI](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/scanners/sonarscanner.md): The SonarScanner CLI is the scanner to use when there is no specific scanner for your build system.
* [Analysis parameters](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/analysis-parameters.md): The most comprehensive listing of the parameters available in SonarQube.
* [Languages](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages.md)
* [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/overview.md): SonarQube provides analysis of different languages depending on the edition you’re running.
* [ABAP](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/abap.md): ABAP analysis is available starting in Developer Edition of SonarQube.
* [Apex](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/apex.md): Apex analysis is available starting in Enterprise Edition of SonarQube.
* [Azure Resource Manager](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/azure-resource-manager.md): SonarQube analysis supports Azure Resource Manager templates in the JSON & Bicep formats, and is available starting in Community Edition.
* [C/C++/Objective-C](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/c-family.md): C/C++/Objective-C analysis is available starting in Developer Edition.
* [CloudFormation](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/cloudformation.md): SonarQube can analyze Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) languages such as CloudFormation, Kubernetes, and Terraform.
* [COBOL](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/cobol.md): Cobol analysis is available starting in Enterprise Edition.
* [C#](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/csharp.md): C# analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
* [Docker](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/docker.md): SonarQube can analyze Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) languages such as CloudFormation, Kubernetes, and Terraform.
* [Flex](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/flex.md): Flex analysis is available starting in all editions of SonarQube.
* [Go](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/go.md): Go analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
* [HTML](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/html.md): HTML analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
* [Java](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/java.md): Java analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
* [JavaScript/TypeScript/CSS](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/javascript-typescript-css.md): JavaScript/TypeScript/CSS analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
* [Kotlin](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/kotlin.md): Kotlin analysis is available starting in all editions of SonarQube.
* [Kubernetes](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/kubernetes.md): SonarQube can analyze Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) languages such as CloudFormation, Kubernetes, and Terraform.
* [PHP](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/php.md): PHP analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
* [PLI](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/pli.md): PLI analysis is available starting in Enterprise Edition.
* [PL/SQL](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/pl-sql.md): PL/SQL analysis is available starting in Developer Edition.
* [Python](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/python.md): Python analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
* [RPG](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/rpg.md): RPG is available starting in Enterprise Edition.
* [Ruby](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/ruby.md): Ruby analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
* [Scala](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/scala.md): Scala analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
* [Swift](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/swift.md): Swift analysis is available starting in Developer Edition.
* [Secrets](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/secrets.md): SonarQube detects exposed Secrets in your source code and language-agnostic config files, starting in Community Edition.
* [Terraform](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/terraform.md): SonarQube can analyze Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) languages such as CloudFormation, Kubernetes, and Terraform.
* [T-SQL](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/t-sql.md): T-SQL analysis is available starting in Developer Edition.
* [VB.NET](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/vb-dotnet.md): VB.NET analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
* [VB6](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/vb6.md): VB6 analysis is available starting in Enterprise Edition.
* [XML](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/languages/xml.md): XML analysis is available in all editions of SonarQube.
* [Test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage.md)
* [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/overview.md): Test coverage reports and test execution reports are important metrics in assessing the quality of your code.
* [Java test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/java-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage as part of the analysis of your Java project.
* [JavaScript/TypeScript test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/javascript-typescript-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage information as part of the analysis of your JS/TS project.
* [.NET test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/dotnet-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage information as part of the analysis of your .NET project.
* [Python test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/python-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage information as part of the analysis of your Python project.
* [PHP test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/php-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage information as part of the analysis of your PHP project.
* [C/C++/Objective-C test coverage](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/c-family-test-coverage.md): SonarQube supports the reporting of test coverage information as part of the analysis of your C/C++/Objective-C project.
* [Generic test data](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/generic-test-data.md): SonarQube supports generic formats for test coverage and test execution import.
* [Test coverage parameters](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/test-coverage-parameters.md): Test coverage reports describe the percentage of your code that has been tested by your test suite during a build.
* [Test execution parameters](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/test-coverage/test-execution-parameters.md): Test execution reports describe which tests within your test suite have been run during a build.
* [Importing external issues](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/importing-external-issues.md)
* [External analyzer reports](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/importing-external-issues/external-analyzer-reports.md): This page lists analysis parameters related to the import of issues raised by external, third-party analyzers.
* [Generic formatted reports](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/importing-external-issues/generic-issue-import-format.md): SonarQube supports a generic import format for raising external issues in code.
* [SARIF reports](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/importing-external-issues/importing-issues-from-sarif-reports.md): SonarQube supports the standard Static Analysis Results Interchange Format (SARIF) for raising external issues in code.
* [Background tasks](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/background-tasks.md): A background task can be: the import of an analysis report, the computation of a portfolio, or the import or export of a project.
* [Pull request analysis](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/pull-request-analysis.md): Pull request analysis shows your pull request’s quality gate and analysis in the SonarQube interface.
* [Branches](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/branches.md)
* [Branch analysis](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/branches/branch-analysis.md): With branch analysis in SonarQube, you can ensure that you’re maintaining consistent code quality all the way down to the branch level of your projects.
* [Branch FAQ](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/branches/branch-faq.md): Frequently asked questions about branch analysis in SonarQube.
* [CI integration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/ci-integration.md)
* [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/ci-integration/overview.md): SonarQube supports integration on multiple platforms allowing you to maintain code quality and security in your projects.
* [Jenkins integration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/ci-integration/jenkins-integration.md): SonarScanners running in Jenkins can automatically detect branches and pull requests in certain jobs.
* [Codemagic integration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/ci-integration/codemagic-integration.md): SonarScanners running in Codemagic can automatically detect branches and merge or pull requests in certain jobs.
* [SCM integration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/scm-integration.md): Collecting SCM data during code analysis can unlock a number of SonarQube features.
* [Security engine custom configuration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/security-engine-custom-configuration.md): Security Engine Custom Configuration is available as part of the Enterprise Edition. The security engine tracks the path that data follows through your code.
* [Scanner environment](/sonarqube-server/10.3/analyzing-source-code/scanner-environment.md): A JRE is always required to run the scanner that performs CI-based analysis. This applies to all scanner variants running on SonarQube.
* [DevOps platform integration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/devops-platform-integration.md)
* [GitHub integration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/devops-platform-integration/github-integration.md): SonarQube’s integration with GitHub Enterprise and GitHub.com allows you to maintain code quality and security in your GitHub repositories.
* [Bitbucket integration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/devops-platform-integration/bitbucket-integration.md)
* [Bitbucket Server integration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/devops-platform-integration/bitbucket-integration/bitbucket-server-integration.md): SonarQube’s integration with Bitbucket Server allows you to maintain code quality and security in your Bitbucket Server repositories.
* [Bitbucket Cloud integration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/devops-platform-integration/bitbucket-integration/bitbucket-cloud-integration.md): SonarQube’s integration with Bitbucket Cloud allows you to maintain code quality and security in your Bitbucket Cloud repositories.
* [GitLab integration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/devops-platform-integration/gitlab-integration.md): SonarQube’s integration with GitLab Self-Managed and GitLab.com allows you to maintain code quality and security in your GitLab projects.
* [Azure DevOps integration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/devops-platform-integration/azure-devops-integration.md): SonarQube’s integration with Azure DevOps allows you to maintain code quality and security in your Azure DevOps repositories.
* [User guide](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide.md)
* [Concepts](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/concepts.md)
* [Clean Code](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/clean-code.md): Clean Code is all code that’s easy to understand and change through structure and consistency, yet remains robust and secure to withstand performance demands.
* [Clean as You Code](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/clean-as-you-code.md): Sonar’s Clean as You Code approach enables developers and organizations to take ownership of code quality by solely focusing on code that’s added or changed.
* [SonarLint Connected Mode](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/sonarlint-connected-mode.md): SonarLint Connected Mode connects SonarLint to your SonarQube project and provides additional benefits you won’t get by using SonarLint or SonarQube alone.
* [Metric definitions](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/metric-definitions.md): SonarQube analysis produces many types of code analysis metrics.
* [Quality gates](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/quality-gates.md): Quality Gates enforce a quality policy in your organization by answering one question: is my project ready for release?
* [Rules](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/rules.md)
* [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/rules/overview.md): SonarQube evaluates your source code against its set of rules to generate issues.
* [Security-related rules](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/rules/security-related-rules.md): The SonarQube Quality Model has four different types of rules: Reliability (bug), Maintainability (code smell), Security (vulnerability and hotspot) rules.
* [Built-in rule tags](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/rules/built-in-rule-tags.md): SonarQube users can add tags to rules and issues and most rules have some built-in tags out of the box.
* [User account](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/user-account.md)
* [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/user-account/overview.md): As a SonarQube user, you have your own space where you can see the things that are relevant to you.
* [Generating and using tokens](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/user-account/generating-and-using-tokens.md): Users can generate tokens that can be used to run analyses or invoke web services without access to the user’s actual credentials.
* [Issues](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/issues.md): While running an analysis, SonarQube raises an issue every time a piece of code breaks a coding rule.
* [Security Hotspots](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/security-hotspots.md): A security hotspot highlights a security-sensitive piece of code that the developer needs to review.
* [Portfolios](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/portfolios.md): The portfolios home page is the central place for managers and tech leads to keep an eye on the releasability of the projects under their supervision.
* [Applications](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/applications.md): An application aggregates multiple projects into a synthetic single project.
* [Security Reports](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/security-reports.md): Security reports give you the big picture of your application’s security. They allow you to know where you stand compared to the most common security mistakes.
* [Activity and history](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/activity-and-history.md): The Activity page offers you the ability to see the evolution of project measures over time.
* [Project page](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/project-page.md): The Project homepage is the entry point of any project showing the releasability status of the project, its current code quality, and the code quality to date.
* [Keyboard shortcuts](/sonarqube-server/10.3/user-guide/keyboard-shortcuts.md): A list of keyboard shortcuts for use with SonarCloud.
* [Project administration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/project-administration.md)
* [Creating and importing projects](/sonarqube-server/10.3/project-administration/creating-and-importing-projects.md): How to create and import projects in SonarQube.
* [Managing project history](/sonarqube-server/10.3/project-administration/managing-project-history.md): One of the most powerful features of SonarQube is that it shows you not just your project health today, but how it has changed over time.
* [Analysis scope](/sonarqube-server/10.3/project-administration/analysis-scope.md): There are many cases where you do not want to analyze every source file in your project. In such cases, you can adjust the analysis scope.
* [Clean as You Code settings](/sonarqube-server/10.3/project-administration/clean-as-you-code-settings.md)
* [Defining new code](/sonarqube-server/10.3/project-administration/clean-as-you-code-settings/defining-new-code.md): Defining what is considered new code is an important part of SonarQube’s Clean as You Code approach to code quality and safety.
* [Managing portfolios](/sonarqube-server/10.3/project-administration/managing-portfolios.md): This page has information on managing and setting up portfolios.
* [Managing applications](/sonarqube-server/10.3/project-administration/managing-applications.md): This page explains how to manage SonarQube applications.
* [PDF reports](/sonarqube-server/10.3/project-administration/pdf-reports.md): PDF reports give a periodic, high-level overview of the overall code quality and security of your projects, applications, or portfolios.
* [Project settings](/sonarqube-server/10.3/project-administration/project-settings.md): Project administration is accessible through the Project Settings menu of each project.
* [Webhooks](/sonarqube-server/10.3/project-administration/webhooks.md): Webhooks notify external services when a project analysis is complete.
* [Instance administration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration.md)
* [Quality profiles](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/quality-profiles.md): Quality profiles are a key part of your SonarQube configuration. They define the set of rules to be applied during code analysis.
* [Security](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/security.md): SonarQube comes with a number of global security features.
* [Authentication and provisioning](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication.md)
* [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/overview.md): SonarQube can delegate authentication via HTTP Headers, GitHub Authentication, GitLab Authentication, Bitbucket Cloud Authentication, SAML, or LDAP.
* [HTTP header](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/http-header.md): You can delegate user authentication to third-party systems (proxies/servers) using HTTP header authentication.
* [LDAP](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/ldap.md): You can configure SonarQube authentication and authorization to an LDAP server (including the LDAP service of Active Directory)
* [SAML](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/saml.md)
* [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/saml/overview.md): You can delegate authentication to a SAML 2.0 identity provider using SAML authentication. SonarQube uses the Service Provider (SP) initiated SAML.
* [How to setup Azure AD](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/saml/how-to-set-up-azure-ad.md): The following content may be useful if you’re using Azure AD as a SAML Identity Provider.
* [How to set up Keycloak](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/saml/how-to-set-up-keycloak.md): The following content may be useful if you’re using Keycloak as a SAML identity provider.
* [How to set up Okta](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/saml/how-to-set-up-okta.md): The following example may be useful if you are using Okta as a SAML identity provider.
* [SCIM](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/saml/scim.md)
* [Overview](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/saml/scim/overview.md): SCIM helps you automatically provision user and groups to SonarQube.
* [SCIM provisioning with Azure AD](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/saml/scim/scim-provisioning-with-azure-ad.md): Enable SCIM to automate user and group provisioning from Azure AD to SonarQube
* [SCIM provisioning with Okta](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/saml/scim/scim-provisioning-with-okta.md): Enable SCIM to automate user and group provisioning from Okta to SonarQube
* [GitHub](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/github.md): To allow users to log in with GitHub credentials, you must use a GitHub App.
* [Bitbucket Cloud](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/bitbucket-cloud.md): To allow users to log in with Bitbucket Cloud credentials, you need to use an OAuth consumer and set the authentication settings in SonarQube.
* [GitLab](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/authentication/gitlab.md): You can delegate authentication to GitLab using a dedicated GitLab OAuth application.
* [Look and feel](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/look-and-feel.md): You can set your own home logo and use a Gravatar avatar.
* [Marketplace](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/marketplace.md): The Marketplace is the place for keeping the pieces of the SonarQube platform up to date.
* [Plugin version matrix](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/plugin-version-matrix.md): This table describes the version of each plugin that is compatible with each version of SonarQube.
* [Housekeeping](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/housekeeping.md): Default settings for SonarQube’s database cleaner.
* [Audit logs](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/audit-logs.md): How to manage the trail of your SonarQube audit logs.
* [Server logs and system info](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/server-logs-and-system-info.md): How to gather detailed information about your SonarQube instance.
* [Notifications](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/notifications.md): Everything to know about configuring SonarQube’s email notifications.
* [License administration](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/license-administration.md): How to retrieve, setup, stage and request new SonarQube licenses.
* [Lines of Code](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/lines-of-code.md): Information about how SonarQube calculates the Lines of Code analyzed to measure against the subscription’s limit defined by the license.
* [Monitoring](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/monitoring.md): Monitor your SonarQube instance to keep it healthy and happy.
* [Project move](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/project-move.md): Project Move allows you to export a project from one SonarQube instance and import it into another SonarQube instance.
* [Compute engine performance](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/compute-engine-performance.md): Accurately monitor and diagnose network latency of your SonarQube instance.
* [SonarQube DB Copy Tool](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/sonarqube-db-copy-tool.md): The SonarQube database copy tool helps you migrate your SonarQube database between vendors.
* [Backup and restore](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/backup-and-restore.md): We recommend using your database’s tools to back up your data.
* [Reindexing](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/reindexing.md): Starting SonarQube after an upgrade or after a restore from a backup triggers a rebuild of the Elasticsearch indexes.
* [Telemetry](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/telemetry.md): SonarQube sends anonymized telemetry data to Sonar daily. No personally identifiable information is sent.
* [Custom messages](/sonarqube-server/10.3/instance-administration/custom-messages.md): Administrators using the Enterprise edition of SonarQube can now display a custom login message that all users will see on their login screen.
* [Extension Guide](/sonarqube-server/10.3/extension-guide.md)
* [Web API](/sonarqube-server/10.3/extension-guide/web-api.md): SonarQube provides web API to access its functionalities from applications.
* [Adding coding rules](/sonarqube-server/10.3/extension-guide/adding-coding-rules.md): How to add custom coding rules to your SonarQube analysis.
* [Developing a plugin](/sonarqube-server/10.3/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin.md)
* [Plugin basics](/sonarqube-server/10.3/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin/plugin-basics.md): The sonar-plugin-api is a Java API used to develop plugins for SonarQube, SonarCloud and SonarLint.
* [Supporting new languages](/sonarqube-server/10.3/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin/supporting-new-languages.md): Six steps to support new languages in SonarQube.
* [Executable lines](/sonarqube-server/10.3/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin/executable-lines.md): Sonar internal guidelines to define executable lines for a language.
* [Adding pages to the webapp](/sonarqube-server/10.3/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin/adding-pages-to-the-webapp.md): Creating page extensions to run in your SonarQube environment.
* [Supporting SCM providers](/sonarqube-server/10.3/extension-guide/developing-a-plugin/supporting-scm-providers.md): Information from the Source Code Management (SCM) provider is used by the SonarQube scanner.
* [Internationalization](/sonarqube-server/10.3/extension-guide/internationalization.md): Guidelines to apply the i18n mechanism and how to help the Community
* [Contributing](/sonarqube-server/10.3/extension-guide/contributing.md): Guidelines about giving feedback and using the SonarQube community forum.

- [Install a plugin](/sonarqube-server/10.2/setup-and-upgrade/install-a-plugin.md): Learn how to install a plugin in SonarQube.
- [Install the server as a cluster](/sonarqube-server/10.2/setup-and-upgrade/install-the-server-as-a-cluster.md): The Data Center Edition allows SonarQube to run in a clustered configuration to make it resilient to failures.
- [Configure and operate a cluster](/sonarqube-server/10.2/setup-and-upgrade/configure-and-operate-a-cluster.md): Once the SonarQube cluster is installed, your configuration allows your SonarQube instance to stay up even in case of a crash or failure in one of the nodes.
